text.div: StructureDefinition for DocumentRefererence as represented in the Provide Document Bundle (ITI-65) transaction with Minimal Metadata compliance in the IHE IT Infrastructure Technical Framework Supplement Mobile access to Health Documents (MHD) Rev. 2.3. The IHE MHD Profile text is Normative, this conformance resource is Informative.

name: Nictiz.IHE.MHD.Provide.Minimal.DocumentReference
title: Nictiz IHE MHD Profile on DocumentReference (DocumentEntry) when used in the Provide Transaction with Minimal Metadata, see Table 3:4.3.1-3.
description: Copied profile on DocumentReference based on IHE IT Infrastructure Technical Framework Supplement - Mobile access to Health Documents (MHD) Rev. 2.3.  See http://wiki.ihe.net/index.php/Mobile_access_to_Health_Documents_(MHD)   The IHE MHD Profile text is Normative, this conformance resource is Informative.
purpose: Copied profile from IHE MHD to have control over the downstream references. The ProvideDocumentBundle.Minimal and DocumentManifest profiles contained error that are only addressed in FHIR R4. These profiles are copied and fixed. This profile is copied and governed by Nictiz because the two mentioned profiles reference to this profile.

element.comment: See ITI TF-2x: Z.9.1.1 Identifier and CDA root plus extension.
When the DocumentReference.identifier carries the entryUUID then the DocumentReference.identifier use shall be ‘official’.

These HL7 FHIR STU3 elements are not used in XDS, therefore would not be present. Document Consumers
should be robust to these elements holding values
Not a contained resource. URL Points to an existing Patient Resource representing the XDS Affinity Domain Patient.

Contained resource of type Practitioner with:
* authorInstitution: Organization
* authorPerson: Practitioner.identifier and Practitioner.name
* authorRole: — Not supported in STU3
* authorSpecialty: Practitioner.qualification
* authorTelecommunication: Practitioner.telecom
These HL7 FHIR STU3 elements are not used in XDS, therefore would not be present. Document Consumers should be robust to these elements holding values.
Note: This is NOT the DocumentReference.meta, as that holds the meta tags for the DocumentReference itself.
These HL7 FHIR STU3 elements are not used in XDS, therefore would not be present. Document Consumers should be robust to these elements holding values.
The size is calculated on the data prior to base64 encoding, if the data is base64 encoded.

The IHE Document Sharing metadata element hash holds the SHA1 hash of the document. The hash is encoded in FHIR in base64Binary, whereas in XDS hexbinary is used. The hash is calculated on the data prior to base64 encoding, if the data is base64 encoded.
These HL7 FHIR STU3 elements are not used in XDS, therefore would not be present. Document Consumers should be robust to these elements holding values.
When referenceIdList contains an encounter, and a FHIR Encounter is available, it may be referenced.

Contained Patient resource with Patient.identifier.use element set to ‘usual’.

Indicates that the data within the XDS document entry be represented as a contained resource. See Section 4.5.4.4.7
See ITI TF-2x: Appendix E.3.1 on CXi mapping to FHIR Identifier
May be filled with URL pointers to Resources found in referenceIdList
